Topic.Title: Obama is the Biggest Scam in American History he belongs in an Illinois Prison next to his pal Rezko

Message.Msg: Like many people right now, I’m guessing about years in prison for Rod Blagojevich. But what I know for sure is that there’s more to the Blago story we’re being told; more about those bugs on his phones. We’ve heard the tapes of the bugs that convicted Blagojevich; not the tapes he says may exonerate him; conversations with Sen. Harry Reid, for example, and Rahm Emanuel. No, says Judge James B. Zagel. No tapes. They are “not admissible under the standards of hearsay at sentencing.” Whatever that means. Blagojevich says there’s evidence on the tapes that will exonerate him, and Judge Zagel says “standards of hearsay at sentencing?” Excuse me, your honor, but why should standards of hearsay-whatever outweigh our need to know all there is to know about a convicted governor? Go ahead and sentence Blagojevich to whatever you think he deserves. But about our need to know, sir, let us hear what’s on those tapes. from cbs Chicago

Topic.Title: Obama is the Biggest Scam in American History he belongs in an Illinois Prison next to his pal Rezko

Message.Msg: Isn't it interesting Harry Reid is mentioned having conversations on the "sealed portion" of the Blago tapes? Given Reid's hearsay assertion on national tv that some un-named person told him Romney cheated on his taxes. One might wonder if Reid is worried what a Romney justice department might look into in regards to his role in the Blago corruption case?

Topic.Title: BAC up 1.97% in Japan tonight (tomorrow Aug. 16th) 622.00

Message.Msg: I hope so. I would sell and take profits as I am not too impressed by the chart. But technical alone is not the whole story. I think the news of some improvement in the economy and few good earnings report could help here. I would rather take profits than wait. I've been profitably trading with BAC since the bottom in March 2009. I bought again in early July (last month in the low $7). I most likely would sell... since technically it is not looking that it may go up much at this time. However, I could jump in again if things look better. GLTU.

Message.Title: Libor subpoenas--what bank is missing here?!!
Message.Msg: ALBANY, N.Y. -- The attorneys general of New York and Connecticut have issued subpoenas to seven banks over the possible manipulation of a global interest rate, a person with knowledge of the matter told The Associated Press on Wednesday. Subpoenas were issued, mostly last month and this month, to Barclays, Citigroup, Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, HSBC, Royal Bank of Scotland and UBS, the person said.

Message.Title: I used to be digusted; now I'm just amused. The gross incompetence of the Obama administration with its' Head Start and Community Organizer Trainee laced Czar heads is not only an embarassment, but also a driving force behind the USA's whirlwind path to total bankruptcy. It just has to end in November.
Message.Msg: Inadequate oversight, lax bookkeeping, sloppy paperwork, haphazard performance agreements and missing financial documentation have plagued U.S. State Department spending of tens of millions of dollars to combat climate change, according to a report by State’s internal financial watchdog — and the problem could be much, much bigger than that. The audit report, issued last month by the State Department’s Office of the Inspector General (OIG), casts an unflattering spotlight on a relatively obscure branch of the State Department that supervises climate change spending, and depicts it as over-extended in its responsibilities, unstaffed in critical monitoring posts, and more concerned with spending money than in monitoring its effectiveness.

Message.Title: FYI
Message.Msg: Insider buys Gifford Charles purchased 482,794 shares on June 12 and currently holds 622,291 shares of the company. Gifford Charles serves as a director of the company. Donald Powell purchased 7,445 shares on June 8 and currently holds 117,567 shares of the company. Donald Powell serves as a director of the company. Financials The company reported the second-quarter financial results on July 18 with the following highlights: Revenue $22.2 billion Net income $0.18 per share Book value $20.2 per share Cash per share $11.48 My analysis The stock has a $20.5 price target from the Point and Figure chart. The price target would coincide with the company's book value per share. The stock has not seen any insider selling this year. The stock is currently trading at a P/E ratio of 8.46. The stock is trading above its 200 day moving average, which could act as a good entry point for the stock

Message.Title: The relevant and unabridged text of Obama's 'You didn't build that' remark
Message.Msg: from his campaign speech in Roanoke, Va., as reported by the Washington Post: "There are a lot of wealthy, successful Americans who agree with me — because they want to give something back. They know they didn’t — look, if you’ve been successful, you didn’t get there on your own. You didn’t get there on your own. I’m always struck by people who think, well, it must be because I was just so smart. There are a lot of smart people out there. It must be because I worked harder than everybody else. Let me tell you something — there are a whole bunch of hardworking people out there. If you were successful, somebody along the line gave you some help. There was a great teacher somewhere in your life. Somebody helped to create this unbelievable American system that we have that allowed you to thrive. Somebody invested in roads and bridges. If you’ve got a business — you didn’t build that. Somebody else made that happen. The Internet didn’t get invented on its own. Government research created the Internet so that all the companies could make money off the Internet." The paragraph-and-a half of preamble and context is the "that" that Obama referred to in the line, "If you've got a business, you didn't build that." Anyone who reads it otherwise either has zero reading comprehension, or is in flagrant denial about the facts. BTW, the first successful attempt at an internet-type network grew out of a government-funded DARPA project, but to be fair, that result was not the stated goal of the program. Respond to 'this' and 'that', you neocon ostriches.

Topic.Title: Why is BAC not joining the rally today?

Message.Msg: Options are about to expire. The market makers benefit the most if the stock price is around the strike price. I believe that tomorrow BAC will close at $8.01 (Or 1-3 cents around $8.00). There have been 3 times more puts than calls this month, meaning that the market makers would do better if the stock price is higher than $8.00 I'm thinking a massive correction downward is in order on Monday. Historically, the day after options have been bad, but at the S&P over 1,400, I think as soon as investors start seeing a downward trend, they will panic. I'll short on Friday. Good luck.

Topic.Title: The relevant and unabridged text of Obama's 'You didn't build that' remark

Message.Msg: You lulu! For starters, how could anyone accuse ME of loving the government or Obama? Focus on the frickin' text, and leave all your red herring and '3 1/2 years of blah-blah' in the cans where they belong. Your logical train derailed as soon as it branded my clarification of the infrastructure framework around which Obama's speech was constructed as a 'non-sequitur', (if you're going to throw around terms you don't understand, at least check their spelling) when it is in fact the central point of both his speech and my argument that his remarks were valid and appropriate. Merely waving your hand and dismissing it as a non-sequitur neither makes it one, nor makes it go away. I hope Romney and Ryan display your same casual disregard of what the rules of a debate are when their turn comes, and I have every reason to believe they will. Once your logical train came off the tracks, it gathered speed by plunging over the cliff of 'and has nothing to do with the success or failure of the business'. The fact that the Internet does not ensure the success of every business does not diminish its importance to many, nor does it make it the end-all and be-all of every business venture. Look up the word 'specious', and try not to put your own inferences and interpretations on the definition you'll find. You have provided another perfect illustration of the inherently defective reasoning of so many on the right. It's a special brand of stupid, and as Ron White observed, you can't fix stupid. God, I never thought I'd say this, but William F. Buckley Jr. would be a breath of fresh air compared to the stifling, mouldering right-wing pap that is the stock and trade of so many of the members of your clan these days. ROTF weeping and gnashing my teeth at the hard truth that mentally-impaired folks like you have such a large say about the future of MY country.

Topic.Title: The relevant and unabridged text of Obama's 'You didn't build that' remark

Message.Msg: What a bunch of mal-educated malarky. You wouldn't recognize logic if it flew up and hit you in the face. You've demonstrated that with your original defense (or maybe I can say defence as the british do) of Obama -- who I guess cannot defend himself without the "little people" like yourself stepping in his manure up to your necks to drag him out. The regard or disregard for rules of debate are irrelevant in politics now, and I am certain that you know nothing about them at any rate. Besides, Obama threw them out a long time ago, but kept his teleprompter and the phone number of friendly judges who can unseal records when his alleged gay lifestyle and all of his dead gay "friends" from the church come up in campaigns. I have to laugh at you pretending to be so smart when you bring up such drivel as Obama's "context". And yes, it absolutely is a non-sequitUr (hope that helped calm your apparent bi-polar disorder) to reference roads & bridges, then building businesses, then backward reference to "that" which -- according to you -- did not reference the object of the sentence it followed but instead the one a few sentences before. And it's INSANE to even believe that, when the context of the entire statement fits perfectly with Pocahantas Warren and the Berkeley prof who does all your party's wordsmithing so that what you mean to say is not what comes out. Because if he said what he meant, people might take offence (british) and castigate him mercilessly for being a mindless idiot. Which he is and has clearly demonstrated. And you shamelessly promote the "they took me out of context" line, a line made famous by FDR when everyone around him had to admit, for the sake of pitiously shutting him up, that they didn't hear what they heard him say and what they had already repeatedly said they heard him say. Sad thing is, it wasn't even necessary for you to fight it; it's absolutely accurate that he meant "business" when he said "that". Face it, he's a marxist. His daddy was a marxist. His mommy was a marxist. His friends were marxists. The man who used to poke him in the bootie in Hawaii was a marxist. His cabinet is riddled with marxists. Unlike you, I don't gnash my teeth at the stupidity of idiotarian left-wingers or even marxists. I laugh until I pee my pants at their inane logic and remarks, but I sleep perfectly every night in my depends knowing that the Obama nightmare ends in January. But don't you worry your victimized brain about me; you just keep on screwin' that chicken.

Message.Title: Fed need to raise interest sooner than later.....
Message.Msg: Minneapolis Fed President Narayana Kocherlakota, speaking in the booming oil town of Williston, N.D., forecast economic growth of 2.5 percent to 3 percent this year and next -- faster than what most of his colleagues and private-sector economists expect. He also suggested the Fed may need to raise rates sooner than late 2014. "I would not have chosen to put that date as far out as the committee did," he said.
